intro: Dipcadi comosum, commonly known as the clustered buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant features a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and forest edges. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
